item.title: Govt starts countervailing duty probe on Vietnamese chemical | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
India Initiates Countervailing Duty Probe on Subsidized Vietnamese Chemical Imports

New Delhi, Dec 30 (PTI)

India has started a countervailing duty investigation into increased imports of Calcium Carbonate Filler Masterbatch, a chemical used in the plastic industry, from Vietnam. The move follows a complaint from domestic manufacturers who allege that the increased imports are subsidized, causing material injury to their businesses.

  • The Directorate General of Trade Remedies (DGTR) has initiated the probe.
  • Domestic manufacturers have alleged that producers/exporters in Vietnam have received actionable subsidies from various levels of the Vietnamese government.
  • Countervailing duties are country-specific duties imposed to safeguard domestic industries against unfair trade subsidies.
"On the basis of the duly substantiated written application filed by the domestic industry...on the basis of the prima facie evidence submitted by the domestic industry, about the subsidization of the product...the authority, hereby, initiates an investigation."

Vietnam is a key trading partner of India, with exports and imports reaching USD 5.47 billion and USD 9.34 billion respectively in 2023-24.

item.title: ‘Boss Called Me A**hole’: Intern, 21, Opens Up About Toxic Workplace In India - News18
item.description:
Intern Shares Experience of Toxic Workplace in India

Date: December 30, 2024

Source: News18

A 21-year-old intern recounted his troubling experiences with a toxic boss who frequently criticized him harshly. He shared a specific incident on Reddit where he was called an “a**hole” for a minor error.

  • The intern described the harsh treatment received from his boss, which included job threats and belittling comments.
  • He expressed uncertainty about whether to escalate the issue to higher management or to find another job while enduring the situation.
  • The intern's post highlighted the emotional toll workplace toxicity can take on new employees.
“To say I was shocked would be an understatement. I’m genuinely frustrated and this isn’t the first time.”

The attention this situation is receiving highlights broader issues of workplace culture in certain industries in India.

item.title: Jio Financial Services Share Price: A better stock for long term investment? Market expert Gaurang Shah answers - ET Now
item.description:
Jio Financial Services Share Price: A better stock for long term investment? Market expert Gaurang Shah answers

Updated Dec 30, 2024 by ET Now Digital

Gaurang Shah of Geojit Financial Services provided a positive long-term outlook for Jio Financial Services, emphasizing patience due to regulatory and operational timelines.

  • Shah encourages a 1.5 to 2-year investment horizon.
  • Investors should hold their shares and consider increasing investments at certain levels.
  • New investors are advised to start accumulating shares.
"We do have positive coverage on Jio Financial Services from a long term point of view... the contribution is likely to come in, over a longer period of time." - Gaurang Shah

Jio Financial Services reported a 3% increase in net profit for Q2 FY25, with total revenues growing but costs also rising significantly.

item.title: Vijay Kedia invests Rs 25 cr in THIS stock, earns Rs 10 cr profit in 21 days - ET Now
item.description:
Vijay Kedia's Rs 25 crore Investment in Greaves Cotton Nets Rs 10 crore Profit in 21 Days

Date & Source: Updated Dec 30, 2024 12:23 IST, ET NOW News

Introduction: Ace investor Vijay Kedia bought shares worth Rs 25 crore in Greaves Cotton via a block deal this month, earning a profit of Rs 10 crore within 21 days.

  1. Greaves Cotton shares have delivered a whopping 56% return in the past one month.
  2. Vijay Kedia bought 12,00,000 shares of Greaves Cotton on December 9.
  3. The rally in Greaves Cotton shares came after the company informed the exchanges about its electric vehicle (EV) arm's plans to launch an IPO.

The IPO includes a fresh issue of equity shares worth Rs 1,000 crore and an offer-for-sale of up to 18.93 crore equity shares by Greaves Cotton Limited and Abdul Latif Jameel Green Mobility Solutions DMCC.

Conclusion: Vijay Kedia's investment in Greaves Cotton has proven profitable, with the company's shares rising due to its electric vehicle arm's plans for an IPO.

item.title: Rs 9 Lakh Honda Sports Car Is Here! - MotorOctane
item.description:
Affordable Honda Sports Car: Buy a Used Honda Accord for Rs 9 Lakh

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: MotorOctane

The Honda Accord is now available for purchase at an accessible price of Rs 9 lakh, appealing to auto enthusiasts who previously found sports cars out of reach.

  • The 3.0-litre V6 engine produces 275 bhp and 339 Nm of torque.
  • A smaller 2.4-litre i-VTEC engine option is also available.
  • The car features a stylish blue-themed exterior with custom elements and adjustable air suspension.
  • Buying a used Honda Accord offers a chance to own a sports car below the cost of a new Honda Amaze.
Some owners have even driven the model for lakhs of kilometres, defying doubts about its reliability.

This model offers a unique opportunity for sports car fans looking for an affordable option, although prospective buyers should conduct thorough inspections and check documentation before making a purchase.

item.title: Top Picks: PSU shares that currently offer the highest potential upside - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Top Picks: PSU shares that currently offer the highest potential upside

Date: October 2023 Source: CNBC TV18

This article discusses the top public sector unit (PSU) stocks that present the most significant upside potential following substantial corrections from their peak values. Stocks such as Oil India, Coal India, and ONGC are highlighted for their projected recoveries.

  • PSU stocks experienced strong performance in the first half of the year but faced declines during the second half, with the Nifty PSE index still up 22% year-to-date.
  • Stocks have corrected between 30% to 50% from their highs, yet are projected to rebound in the next year.
  • Oil India is the top gainer with a 70% return, but down 45% from its peak, with a projected upside of 47%.
  • Coal India predicted to rise 41% after a 30% decline from peak levels.
  • PFC and ONGC also show strong recovery potential, with estimated upsides of 35.4% and 35%, respectively.
  • REC and NTPC have notable projections of 34% and 33.5% upside, respectively.
“Despite the corrections, analysts remain bullish on several PSU stocks, suggesting significant recovery potential in the coming months.”

In conclusion, various PSU stocks are well-positioned for recovery, making them enticing options for investors looking to capitalize on their projected upside.

item.title: Gold price appreciates as traders anticipate Fed policy outlook next year - FXStreet
item.description:
Gold Price Recovers Recent Losses

Date: December 31, 2022 Source: FXStreet

The Gold price (XAU/USD) has recovered its recent losses, currently trading near $2,620.00, as markets anticipate signals regarding the United States (US) economy and the Federal Reserve’s (Fed) interest rate outlook under the incoming Trump administration.

  • Gold gains support due to increased risk aversion and potential trade conflicts.
  • The outlook for fewer Fed rate cuts in 2025 might cap the upside for Gold.
  • Geopolitical risks, including Israeli attacks on Gaza hospitals, also support Gold prices.
  • Gold is set to finish the year with a 27% gain, its strongest annual performance since 2010.

Gold prices are influenced by the US Dollar Index (DXY), US Treasury bond yields, and geopolitical tensions. The Fed's recent hawkish pivot and the anticipated economic strategies of the incoming Trump administration are also key factors affecting Gold prices.

The daily chart indicates a consolidation phase for Gold, with the 14-day Relative Strength Index (RSI) hovering just below the 50 mark. Key resistances and supports are identified for potential future price movements.

item.title: Ola Electric Mobility shares fall after two top management exits - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Ola Electric Mobility Shares Drop Following Management Changes

Published on: Dec 30, 2024 11:14 AM IST

Shares of Ola Electric Mobility Ltd. fell over 2% amidst the announcement of two senior executives' resignations, adding to a trend of leadership changes at the company.

  • The stock is currently trading at ₹86.45, down 3.87% from the opening highs.
  • Both Anshul Khandelwal (CMO) and Suvonil Chatterjee (CTO) resigned effective December 27 for personal reasons.
  • Ola Electric has been experiencing several top-level departures and recently announced a significant expansion of its store network to 4,000.
  • The company is also preparing for the launch of motorcycles and electric three-wheelers, which are expected to enhance volume.
  • A report from Citi suggested a recovery in service perception and rated the stock as a 'buy' with a target of ₹90.
"While the service perception has been negative offlate, Citi said that it will subside going forward."

Ola Electric aims for continued growth amidst leadership changes and new product launches.

item.title: Stocks to BUY for 2025: Up to 80% upside! Adani Enterprises, IndusInd Bank, SBI Life and more - LIST - ET Now
item.description:
Stocks to BUY for 2025: Up to 80% upside!

Updated Dec 30, 2024 by ET NOW Digital

As we approach 2025, investors are eager to find stocks with the potential for significant profits. Bloomberg researchers conducted a poll focusing on the Nifty Mid Cap 100 and Nifty Small Cap 100 indexes.

Key Points:

  • Large Cap Stocks: Adani Enterprises is forecasted to have an 80% increase in price. IndusInd Bank and SBI Life are expected to reach 40-50% growth.
  • Mid Cap Stocks: Oil India anticipated to offer returns over 40%. NLC India and AB Capital both expected to give returns above 39%.
  • Small Cap Stocks: Sterling and Wilson Solar could see over 80% returns; Great Eastern Shipping and JK Bank likely above 55%.

Market Outlook 2025:

Prateek Agrawal from Motilal Oswal AMC emphasizes the bright future for the electronics and nuclear sectors, as well as optimism for India's growth trajectory.

“The growth opportunity that our nation provides entices many individuals. We are in the world's largest economy; this is our moment, and we are developing strongly.”

(Disclaimer: The above article is meant for informational purposes only, and should not be considered as any investment advice. ET NOW DIGITAL suggests consulting financial advisors before making any money-related decisions.)

item.title: Suchir Balaji's mother says his death not suicide; Elon Musk 'replies'; says 'it doesn't....' - The Times of India
item.description:
Suchir Balaji's Mother Contests Suicide Claims Amid Elon Musk's Response

Publication Date: October 2023; Source: Times of India

In the wake of Suchir Balaji's death, his mother has publicly stated that her son's passing should not be labeled as a suicide. This statement has drawn a response from tech magnate Elon Musk.

  • Suchir Balaji's mother asserts that her son's death was not a suicide.
  • Elon Musk has responded to the claims made by Balaji's mother.
  • The situation has sparked considerable public interest and debate.
“It doesn't make sense to label it as suicide,” stated Balaji's mother.

This incident highlights the complexities surrounding the circumstances of Balaji's death and has provoked further discussion in both media and public forums.

item.title: The mother of all Indian IPOs: Is it coming in the year 2025? - The Economic Times
item.description:
The mother of all Indian IPOs: Will 2025 be the year India witnesses its largest-ever listing?

Date: Not specified Source: Economic Times

The article discusses the robust trend of IPOs in India, highlighting significant fundraising in 2024 and the anticipation of continued growth leading into 2025.

  • India witnessed a surge in IPOs in 2024 with companies like Hyundai Motors raising significant funds.
  • Equity fundraising has surpassed Rs 3 lakh crore, showcasing a 64% increase from the previous record in 2021.
  • Major companies, including LG India and Flipkart, are preparing to list in 2025.
  • The potential for a record-breaking IPO in 2025 is emphasized, particularly for Reliance Jio.
“India Inc’s significant fundraising in 2024 can be attributed to a favorable macroeconomic environment, a robust equity market, and increased investor confidence...” - Pinak Bhattacharya

In conclusion, 2025 could see historic IPO activity in India, indicating a bullish outlook for the market.

item.title: Unimech Aerospace IPO listing tomorrow, GMP surges to 90% over issue price - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Unimech Aerospace IPO Listing Tomorrow, GMP Soars to 90% Over Issue Price

Date: December 30, 2024 Source: CNBC TV18

The ₹500 crore initial share sale of Unimech Aerospace and Manufacturing Ltd. is set to list tomorrow, and the grey market premium has surged significantly, indicating strong investor interest.

  • The IPO opened for public bidding from December 23 to December 26.
  • The grey market premium (GMP) for Unimech Aerospace shares is currently at ₹715, suggesting potential listing gains over 90%.
  • The IPO was highly subscribed, with an overall subscription of 175.31 times.
  • Qualified institutional bidders (QIBs) subscribed 317.63 times, while non-institutional investors (NIIs) subscribed 263.78 times.
  • Retail and employee allocations were booked 56.87 times and 97.81 times, respectively.
  • The company raised ₹149.5 crore from anchor investors prior to the IPO.
  • Proceeds from the IPO will fund machinery purchases, working capital, and debt repayments.
“The solid response from investors reflects confidence in Unimech’s capabilities in the aerospace and defense sector.”

Incorporated in 2016, Unimech Aerospace and Manufacturing specializes in complex products for aerospace applications, with a focus on engineering solutions.

item.title: Order VII Rule 11 CPC - Where It's Glaring From Averments That Suit Is Hopelessly Time-Barred, Plaint Is ... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Reiterates Rules on Time-Barred Suits

Publication Date: December 20, 2024

Source: LiveLaw

The Supreme Court set aside an order from the High Court of Bombay regarding a time-barred civil suit, emphasizing that courts should reject plaints that are evidently barred by limitation.

  • The Supreme Court overturned a 2016 High Court order that upheld a trial court's dismissal of a suit due to limitation issues.
  • It affirmed that limitation is a mixed question of fact and law, but suits hopelessly barred should be rejected at the outset.
  • Respondent claimed ownership based on descent from Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, but the court found the suit barred by the Limitation Act.
The Supreme Court noted: "The plaintiff is liable to be non-suited on the ground of limitation... the claim for possession is also barred and consequently, the relief of recovery of possession is also hopelessly barred by limitation."

In conclusion, the Supreme Court's ruling supports the efficient handling of civil litigation by discouraging time-wasting lawsuits.

item.title: Google CEO Describes A 2025 Beyond A Search Box - Search Engine Journal
item.description:
Google CEO Describes A 2025 Beyond A Search Box

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: CNBC

Sundar Pichai, CEO of Google, has outlined the company’s strategy for 2025, focusing on consumer-oriented AI solutions and the development of new applications that represent a shift from the traditional search interface.

  • Emphasis on AI apps as the primary interface for user interaction rather than the standard search box.
  • Introduction of Project Mariner, an AI tool for integrating information from different platforms into Google Maps.
  • Growth and scaling of the Gemini App as a key focus for 2025.
  • Project Astra, a universal assistant, aims to interact seamlessly across various domains and modalities.
“With the Gemini app, there is strong momentum, particularly over the last few months… But we have some work to do in 2025 to close the gap and establish a leadership position there as well.” - Sundar Pichai
“…the products themselves are going to evolve massively over the next year or two.” - Co-founder of Google Deep Mind

The developments in AI indicate a significant transformation in how users will engage with Google services, moving beyond traditional search methods and integrating a more comprehensive AI-driven experience.

item.title: Government To Impose This New Tax If You Own A Car! - MotorOctane
item.description:
Delhi Government Plans New Congestion Tax for Vehicle Owners

Date: Recent
Source: MotorOctane

The Delhi government has proposed a new congestion tax on vehicles entering the city during peak hours to combat rising pollution and traffic congestion.

  • The GST on used cars has increased from 12% to 18%.
  • The congestion tax will apply during peak hours from 8 AM to 10 AM and 5:30 PM to 8 PM.
  • Exemptions will apply for two-wheelers and non-polluting vehicles like EVs.
  • The tax will be collected automatically via FASTag and number plate recognition technology.
  • Revenue generated will be used to improve public transportation and road infrastructure.
“Currently, Delhi is witnessing increasing pollution thanks to stubble burning and vehicular emission.”

This new tax is still in planning stages and will require necessary legal adjustments to the Motor Vehicles Act.

item.title: Senores Pharmaceuticals Listing: Shares debut strong with 53% premium over IPO price - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO Debuts with 53% Premium, Raising ₹582 Crore

Publication Date: [Insert Date], Source: [Insert Source]

The Ahmedabad-based Senores Pharmaceuticals made a strong debut on the stock market, with its shares listed at ₹600, a 53.45% premium on its issue price on the NSE. On the BSE, the stock debuted at ₹593.70, a 52% premium.

  1. The company raised about ₹582 crore from the primary market.
  2. The listing was below grey market premium (GMP) estimates, with GMP holding its ground despite market volatility.
  3. The IPO was subscribed 93.41 times, with strong demand from all categories.
  4. Proceeds will be used for setting up a manufacturing facility, funding working capital, supporting inorganic growth, and paying debt, among other purposes.
  5. The company specializes in developing and manufacturing specialty pharmaceutical products and reported strong earnings growth.
The IPO was subscribed 93.41 times, indicating strong investor interest.

The successful IPO indicates robust demand for pharmaceutical stocks and the company's potential for growth.

item.title: BSE, NSE Holiday List 2025: Check Stock Market Holiday Calendar Here - NDTV Profit
item.description:
BSE, NSE Holiday List 2025: Check Stock Market Holiday Calendar Here

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

The National Stock Exchange (NSE) and the BSE have announced their trading holiday calendar for 2025, detailing a total of 14 holidays apart from weekends.

  • October and April will have the most holidays, with three each due to various festivals.
  • March and August each feature two holidays, while February, May, November, and December have one holiday each.
  • January and several other months have no holidays in 2025.
  • The first holiday is for Mahashivratri on February 26, followed by Holi and Id-Ul-Fitr in March.
  • April includes consecutive holidays for Ambedkar Jayanti and Good Friday.
The share market holiday list provides investors and traders with clarity, helping them plan their strategies for buying and selling stocks.

This calendar is vital for investors to plan their trading strategies effectively in the Indian stock market, which observes various regional, national, and religious holidays.

item.title: Amid H-1B debate, US Attorney accuses Indian CEO of ruining culture: Hired only Indians, forced salary cu - The Times of India
item.description:
US Attorney Accuses Indian CEO of Ruining Company Culture Amid H-1B Debate

Publication Date: December 26, 2024 | Source: Times of India

The ongoing H-1B visa debate in the US intensifies as a US attorney’s post criticizes an Indian CEO for allegedly destroying company culture, instituting salary cuts, and laying off 15% of the workforce.

  • The attorney claims the CEO hired only Indian executives and outsourced work to India.
  • Employees faced a 10% salary cut and frozen promotions during the pandemic.
  • Many employees reported increased workload and diminished job security.
  • Client satisfaction reportedly decreased due to changes in management and lack of support.
  • The post has sparked discussions on social media about H-1B visas and the trend of Indian executives in American companies.
“Work product also suffered across the company. Client satisfaction drastically decreased as a result.”

This event highlights concerns among American workers regarding the shift in company culture due to leadership changes and raises questions about immigration policies affecting the tech industry.
